item.description:
No, not a new Monty Python movie, but a first for our meetup - a Bollywood movie!!

If you are wondering what Bollywood is, it refers to the Indian film industry based in Mumbai (Bombay) that produces colorful musicals in Hindi (one of the many Indian languages). Bollywood comes from Bombay+Hollywood. More here.

The movie is "Chak De! India" and the show-time is 3pm on Sunday, August 26 at the Capitol Theater in Arlington. I don't think we've had a meetup at the Capitol theater either (Tom, please correct me if I'm wrong), so that's another first.

The movie is about a disgraced coach who leads the Indian women's field hockey team to glory, and is based on a true story. It has got both good reviews and word-of-mouth (in the US and India) and has done well in India. It is not a typical candy-floss movie, though those who expect a Kurosawa movie will probably be disappointed. It also features Bollywood's biggest heart-throb and popular actor Shahrukh Khan.

From one reviewer:
"Chak De! India is the basic, every-single-sports-movie story of a disgraced player, here called Kabir Khan, pulling together a team of misfits to do the impossible -- here winning the World Championship. This is also a return to glory for Shah Rukh Khan, the superstar doing excellently as he tackles a cast with (almost) entirely deplorable acting chops and makes you believe. Director Shimit Amin shoves a hockey stick into the actor's hand, and -- fitter than he's looked in years -- Khan flies across cinematic AstroTurf, and shines."
Rest of the review.

ETA. Another review from NYT.

A few notes.
1. The company website that organizes Bollywood movies has the movie scheduled for Sunday, but when I called Capitol Theater to confirm, they didn't have that information in their system and wouldn't know for sure till tomorrow. So, I will confirm (or cancel) the meetup event here latest by Friday. *****CONFIRMED! The movie meetup is on.

2. Since this is the first time I'm watching a movie at Capitol theater, please call the theater at 781-648-6022 or check their website for parking information and how to get there.

3. Based on past experience, there's a good possibility that for this particular movie, the theater will accept CASH ONLY for tickets. Please come prepared.

4. If you know of any decent not-expensive restaurants near the theater (that can seat ~15-20 people) and if you can recommend a few, please drop me a note as I'm unfamiliar with what's in the Arlington area near the Capitol theater.

Amit will be holding a meetup sign near the hall exit (NOT outside the building) after the movie is over and we'll proceed to a nearby restaurant for food, conversation and discussion.
